intro: Gymnocline myriophylla, commonly known as the smooth-leaf myriophyllum, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Halocarpyceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically smooth and lance-shaped. The plant thrives in freshwater environments, such as ponds and slow-moving streams, where it can anchor itself to substrates. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a feature common in many aquatic angiosperms. Gymnocline myriophylla plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small invertebrates.
